Title: Data Analyst, Partner Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be directly responsible for improving the Partners‚Äô experience across their whole journey, making them grow and improve user UX, from the data perspective. The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented, analytical, and passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship. The role would mean not only providing data and insights to guide the team to make the right decisions but also owning full projects related to the Partners. Ownership and responsibilities will be given to you from day one.

THE JOURNEY


Create and manage core data products that are used to execute impact analysis to evaluate our project performance.
Improve current data sources & reporting to make faster decisions.
Ensure data pipelines and development processes are operationalprocesses operational and efficient.
Work on strategic analysis that will help to detect further opportunities
Understand, deep-dive and have a complete awareness of Glovo‚Äôs partner operations situation at all times. Develop analytical frameworks, analyses, dashboards and models for the whole organization.
Raise product requests to improve partners' UX and scalability. Identify tech feature improvements and give proactive feedback to the Product team.
Execute end-to-end projects at a global level


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1/2 years of experience providing business teams with data for decision-making
Analytical skills: breaking big problems into smaller ones and problem-solving skills, with adaptability to change, is a must
Experience developing in Python and writing complex SQL queries is a must
Experience with reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, and Google Data Studio is a must
Experience with data engineering-related tools (Airflow, Github, etc) is a plus.
Good communication skills in English (plus Spanish as a bonus)
Great team player and organizational skills
Experience in managing projects is a plus
International studies or experience is a plus


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
With Confluent, organisations can harness the full power of continuously flowing data to innovate and win in the modern digital world. We have a purpose that drives us to do better every day ‚Äì we're creating an entirely new category within data infrastructure - data streaming. This technology will allow every organisation to create experiences and use the power of data in ways that profoundly impact the way we all live. This impact is our purpose and drives us to do better every day.

One Confluent. One team. One Data Streaming Platform.

Data Connects Us.

About The Role

This role will be a key member of the Field Reporting & Analytics team to support the Sales and Customer Success Group (CSG) organizations. In this role, you will utilize our business systems data to analyze and provide insight into the organization's historical and forecasted performance. Additionally, this role will apply creativity and analytical thinking to design and implement operational dashboards and ad hoc reporting.

The role requires that you have a strong technical knowledge of database and business intelligence design, and how to transform data into insight so we can utilize world class functional dashboards, reporting, and analysis to ensure data-driven decisions are a daily part of how we work. To do this you will work with our Sales and CSG Strategy & Operations teams to provide business insight.

A background in Salesforce CRM Analytics, Tableau, SQL, experiences supporting sales, pre-sales and/or a post-sales customer business is preferred. This position reports to the Senior Manager, Business Analytics in Field Analytics & Reporting.

What You Will Do


Create and maintain Salesforce CRM Analytics/Tableau dashboards that allow us to measure and effectively execute strategies that guide the Customer Solutions Group & Sales Team to actions and investment
Own core activities for small analytic projects of moderate to high complexity
Gather requirements, design, and build dashboards & analytic reporting based on stakeholders & leadership needs to help monitor performance for all key indicators.
Work with the Senior Manager, Business Analytics to define and maintain a set of data definitions and available measures across the Sales & CSG business
Work with the Senior Manager, Business Analytics to establish a roadmap and rationalization plan for all of our dashboards, reporting, analysis tools, and processes deployed across Sales & CSG


What You Will Bring


BS degree, preferably with a post graduate degree in Data Science, Information Technology, Computing, Business, Operations, or a related discipline.
Relevant industry experience or demonstrable applied knowledge of working with Salesforce CRM Analytics, Tableau or other data visualization software, Salesforce, SQL (large data sets/data warehousing).
The ability to communicate cross-functionally, derive requirements, set and meet deadlines, and deliver insightful analysis and/or models
Keen attention to detail while completing complex tasks
Open, growth mindset and high degrees of self motivation, fostered in a fast-paced, high growth, dynamic environment


Come As You Are

At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Click HERE to review our Candidate Privacy Notice which describes how and when Confluent, Inc., and its group companies, collects, uses, and shares certain personal information of California job applicants and prospective employees.

Title: Data Analyst I (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable

üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Title: Game Data Analyst (Big Data)
Description:
About Gameloft

Leader in the development and publishing of mobile games, Gameloft¬Æ has established itself as one of the top innovators in its field since 2000. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, two of which are featured in the ‚ÄúTop 10 Games by All-Time Worldwide Downloads‚Äù from App Annie. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt¬Æ, Order & Chaos, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Disney¬Æ, Marvel¬Æ, Hasbro¬Æ, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel¬Æ and Ferrari¬Æ. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 4,600 people worldwide. Every month, 114 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft Advertising Solutions, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company.

All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.

The Game Data Analyst will join the Game Design & Monetization team and contribute to all projects active in the studio by gathering the information required to address important user behavior-related queries for that team and other important internal stakeholders (game managers, producers, engineers, marketing, etc.) and by driving analysis aiming to improve performance and results of the games.

Besides descriptive statistics and metrics, team requests will also include user clustering analysis, modeling, and projections, and DA should be flexible and adapt to any new type of analysis requested.

DATA REPORTING


Satisfy stakeholders data requests through in-house data mining tools.
Deliver clean, accurate and understandable data visualization and dashboards.
Provide on-going reporting and performance monitoring from multiple data sources.


ANALYSIS


Analyze large, complex data sets about the behavior of millions of game players to address strategic and operational business questions
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from mobile / game data to shape features, game economies and future product roadmaps
Develop frameworks, models, and tools to ensure data influences decisions at all levels
Present your findings to cross functional team members in a presentation setting


METRICS GENERATION AND QUALITY


Review metrics generation and ensure quality and accurate delivery of such.
Assistance on management and maintenance of tracking specs.



3+ years of experience with Big Data
Excellent SQL.
Familiarity with BI tools (Looker, Tableau or Power BI).
Proactive, resourceful.
Fluent English level.
At least Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent in relevant technical field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering,‚Ä¶)
Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders.
Videogames player


Bonus Skills


Familiarity with SQL databases and ETL processes.
Familiarity with designing and analyzing A/B tests.
Understanding of advanced statistical methods.
Basic Python knowledge (Pandas/Matplotlib/sklearn).
4+ years of experience with Big Data


Why Join the World of Gameloft?


Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience within a company that is constantly growing!
Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers!
Because you want to be part of an international environment with daily contact with other countries & cultures!
Because you want to work in an inclusive equal opportunity workplace!
Or, just because you‚Äôre looking for a great place to work!



Permanent contract, full-time job with excellent Social Benefits.
25 vacation days per year
Private medical health insurance
Flexible compensation with Ticket Restaurant Card
Free language courses
Birthday day off + option to work a shortened schedule on three days.
Flexible work-from-home hybrid model
Merit based salary progression system and a competitive initial salary package.
Career-development opportunities.
Excellent local working conditions (quality of offices, geographical location of office in the centre of Barcelona).
... and Tuesday and Thursday afterwork beers!


We can‚Äôt wait to find our next great talent!

Join our team, recently recognized in Forbes' top 100 companies to work for! We're gamers from all walks of life, united in creating a culture of inclusivity. Partnering with organizations like COGAM, we ensure a safe workplace for everyone, regardless of background or gaming preference. Whether you're a casual or hardcore gamer on any platform (we're cross-platform now!), we want you to feel like you belong. Be part of shaping the gaming industry with us!

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted and your CV will be saved in our files for a period of 6 months.

Want to know more? Please visit our Website www.gameloft.com

About Gameloft

Leader in the development and publishing of mobile games, Gameloft¬Æ has established itself as one of the top innovators in its field since 2000. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, two of which are featured in the ‚ÄúTop 10 Games by All-Time Worldwide Downloads‚Äù from App Annie. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt¬Æ, Order & Chaos, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Disney¬Æ, Marvel¬Æ, Hasbro¬Æ, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel¬Æ and Ferrari¬Æ. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 4,600 people worldwide. Every month, 114 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft Advertising Solutions, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company.

All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.

The Game Data Analyst will join the Game Design & Monetization team and contribute to all projects active in the studio by gathering the information required to address important user behavior-related queries for that team and other important internal stakeholders (game managers, producers, engineers, marketing, etc.) and by driving analysis aiming to improve performance and results of the games.

Besides descriptive statistics and metrics, team requests will also include user clustering analysis, modeling, and projections, and DA should be flexible and adapt to any new type of analysis requested.

DATA REPORTING

  • Satisfy stakeholders data requests through in-house data mining tools.
  • Deliver clean, accurate and understandable data visualization and dashboards.
  • Provide on-going reporting and performance monitoring from multiple data sources.

ANALYSIS

  • Analyze large, complex data sets about the behavior of millions of game players to address strategic and operational business questions
  • Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from mobile / game data to shape features, game economies and future product roadmaps
  • Develop frameworks, models, and tools to ensure data influences decisions at all levels
  • Present your findings to cross functional team members in a presentation setting

METRICS GENERATION AND QUALITY

  • Review metrics generation and ensure quality and accurate delivery of such.
  • Assistance on management and maintenance of tracking specs.


  • 3+ years of experience with Big Data
  • Excellent SQL.
  • Familiarity with BI tools (Looker, Tableau or Power BI).
  • Proactive, resourceful.
  • Fluent English level.
  • At least Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent in relevant technical field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering,‚Ä¶)
  • Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders.
  • Videogames player

Bonus Skills

  • Familiarity with SQL databases and ETL processes.
  • Familiarity with designing and analyzing A/B tests.
  • Understanding of advanced statistical methods.
  • Basic Python knowledge (Pandas/Matplotlib/sklearn).
  • 4+ years of experience with Big Data

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data ‚Äì we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues


About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you‚Äôll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You


High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner


Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry‚Äôs top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:


A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees


Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city‚Äôs best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don‚Äôt hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About S360

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Product

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Barcelona

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale‚Äôs use Tabby‚Äôs technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

You‚Äôll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:


Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:


3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data ‚Äî extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple‚Äôs ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google‚Äôs Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Fluency in English.



Job Benefits:


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance.



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
What You'll Do:

The goal of Business Performance AX (BPAX) team is to provide analytical insights at global level to key internal stakeholders. Aligned with the Criteo culture of data-based decision making, the team has a unique capability to unveil business opportunities: insights on business performance drive sales and operational actions that maximize revenue and margin.

As an Analyst Intern in the Business Performance team you will implement a data-driven approach to understand and explain the business. This role involves working with a considerable amount of complex data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of innovative ways to analyse data and create a comprehensive story.

This internship is for a duration of 6 months starting in February 2025.

Your Mission:


Provide analytical insights on Criteo performance, changes of market environment and competition
Size business growth opportunities / threats. Translate findings into actionable insights for multiple levels of stakeholders
Based on external and internal data, understand client behaviours, qualify potential of clients and prospects on new and existing business

Title: Data Analyst, Sales & Automation (They, She, He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a highly skilled and analytical Data Analyst to join our dynamic Sales & Automation team. In this role, you will collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to uncover actionable insights that support Glovo's business objectives.

THE JOURNEY


Bring your boldest ideas to life and make an immediate global impact.
Apply statistical methods and business acumen to analyze performance, forecast trends, and optimize sales processes through data-backed insights.
Write complex queries to extract, clean, and analyze large datasets from sales and CRM platforms, ensuring accurate insights for decision-making.
Build and maintain dashboards in tools like Tableau or Looker to visualize KPIs such as conversion rates, lead scoring, and sales performance for stakeholders.
Use Python or similar programming languages to automate repetitive data tasks, like lead assignment or pipeline updates, enhancing team efficiency.
Partner with the Commercial Strategy leadership to set performance targets, recommend actions for improvement and work together to integrate positive changes.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.
1-2 years of work experience, outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably with 2 years in Sales Operations.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with analytics/ds libraries such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
Nice to have: previous knowledge of Bigquery or other data storage platforms such as Starburst and prior knowledge of Salesforce
Knowledge of BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, and practical experience analyzing data, program metrics, and performance
Fluency in English is a must.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Lead Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Main challenge

Together with a talented team of data analysts and scientists, you will extract actionable insights from our vast marketing and in-game data, helping drive game growth and enhance marketing profitability and efficiency.

What It Means On a Daily Basis


Develop an in-depth understanding of our data warehouse, focusing on Marketing and game tracking data.
Become an expert in our marketing data dimensions and measurement definitions.
Conduct comprehensive 360-degree analyses to provide timely, data-driven answers to key stakeholder questions.
Translate analytical findings into strategic recommendations for Marketing and game teams.
Leverage statistical analysis to optimize Marketing testing methodologies and outcomes.
Manage and level up a small team of marketing analysts


Who You Will Be Working With

Joining our Global Data Science and Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with our Marketing vertical teams, including User Acquisition (UA), Influencer Marketing, and Studio Marketing Activation.

WHO YOU ARE


A collaborative team player with a positive attitude and excellent organizational skills. Good verbal, written, and interpersonal skills needed
You pay strong attention to data quality and you have a passion for deep quantitative analysis
A genuine passion for gaming and the gaming industry


What You Need To Succeed


5+ years of professional experience, 2+ years as a team lead
SQL (Big Query) expertise, crafting complex & efficient queries
Python and R expertise is required
Proven ability in creating clear and impactful data visualizations and dashboards using Data Viz tool(s)
Familiarity with key marketing metrics (CPI, RoAS, creative optimization) and channels
Solid understanding of statistical analysis and its applications in marketing and UA.
Fluent in English, good presenter and communicator.


Please attach a resume in English to your application.

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can‚Äôt see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that‚Äôs still got a start-up heart.

About Our Marketing Analytics Team

Our Kiwi.com Marketing Analytics team supports various Marketing areas, helping to ensure they operate efficiently and meet their goals. This involves a strong focus on evaluating the impact on our global profitability and assessing the return on investment for current marketing activities and uncovering potential areas of opportunity. Our work is particularly interesting because it analyzes complex data to uncover insights that drive strategic decision-making. The insights and strategies developed by our Marketing Analytics team inform marketing decisions that enhance overall profitability and contribute to the sustainable growth of Kiwi.com.

What You Will Do


You will analyze and report on CRM performance, identifying key drivers and growth opportunities.
You will uncover insights and develop hypotheses for testing, iteration, and continuous improvement.
You will monitor and assess marketing campaign performance, providing actionable recommendations based on CRM data.
You will build and refine models to understand customer behavior, including Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) and Recency, Frequency and Monetary value RFM).
You will model business cases for new campaigns and promotions focused on customer acquisition and retention.
You will collaborate with stakeholders and the CRM team to create impactful, user-friendly self-service dashboards, align on data strategies, ensure data quality, and implement CRM-driven initiatives.


What You Will Need


Previous experience in CRM systems and/or e-commerce businesses, with a focus on analyzing customer data to derive actionable insights.
Your advanced SQL and Excel/Google Sheets skills, with proficiency in data extraction, manipulation, and reporting.
Experience working with Data Visualization Tools (we use Looker).
Experience in building data models that drive revenue growth and customer loyalty, including developing business cases for promotions to acquire or retain customers.
Your proven knowledge of CRM platforms such as Exponea (or equivalent) and experience leveraging this data for targeted marketing and customer engagement activities.
A strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and quality in data analysis and reporting
Your curiosity, openness to learning, and strong collaboration skills.
You are a great communicator with excellent spoken and written English, including your proven ability to communicate complex results to less data-savvy users.


We offer you


We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days, sick days, private medical insurance, Employee Assistance Program, Wellhub membership, the annual subscription for El Bicing.
Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your kiwi anniversaries.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs are welcome in our offices.


Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/.

Title: Data Analyst Marketing Intelligence (f/m/d)
Description:
To support our Marketing Intelligence team we are searching for a Data Analyst Marketing Intelligence (f/m/d) to be based in our Barcelona office.

What You Will Do


Analyze customer journey behavior and generate findings into online marketing campaigns
Design, build and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and insights
Development and implementation of marketing attribution / allocation models across all media channels such as SEA, SEO, Affiliate, Email, Performance Display
Partner with the data engineering team to improve data pipelines and ensure seamless integration of new data sources
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data
Continuous optimization, monitoring, and quality checkups of already existing processes & daily business


Who You Are


University degree in (business) informatics, mathematics, data science, economics/business administration, or another relevant field; understanding of (online) marketing is a bonus
At least 4 years work experience within an analytical role (such as BI, web analytics or CRM) ideally within an e-commerce environment
Strong analytical skills with experience in working with large datasets
Advanced knowledge of statistical methods and tools (e.g. SQL, Python, R, Excel, ETL)
Experience with Power BI is a plus
Understanding of business drivers with a strong analytical mindset and affinity to numbers
Initial experience with performance marketing channels, ad-tech and web-tracking
Result driven and high standards in quality and precision
You are a passionate, committed team player with a high degree of personal initiative
Fluent in Business English


What We Offer


Up to 32 days of holiday, depending on the length of service, starting with 28 days (excluding public holidays and weekends)
Mobile office with up to 40% of your total contracted hours (job and position permitting)
10 days/year of mobile office abroad in EU-countries (job and position permitting)
Language & e-learning courses
Staff discount of up to 30%
Flexible remuneration benefits (ticket restaurant, ticket transport and ticket child care (guarder√≠a))
Discounted membership for selected sports platforms & gyms
Private health insurance
Access to LinkedIn Learning
Individual support on mental health & well-being
Social Day
Employee Share Purchase Plan

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Permanent, Barcelona)
Description:
Senior Data Analyst:
We are seeking a seasoned data professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment, dedicated to enhancing operational transparency and precision.

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business success, this is the role for you.

About the Role:
As a Senior Data & Operations Analyst, you will be at the forefront of our data management and operational control efforts. You will combine your analytical acumen with a strategic vision to optimize processes, ensuring that our data is accurate and actionable. Your expertise will be pivotal in refining our production and sales-controlling processes, enabling informed decision-making across all levels of the organization.

We need someone who can:
- Create and maintain dashboards and reporting tools to provide real-time visibility into operational performance.
- Analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure operational efficiency.
- Prepare detailed reports on production and sales performance.
- Identify and implement process improvements
- Work closely with production, sales, management and the finance team to gather necessary data and insights

Key Responsibilities:

Data Management & Process Optimization:

Lead initiatives to refine processes, enhancing operational efficiency and ensuring data integrity.
Guarantee the accuracy of data sourced from various channels, ensuring reliable insights.
Develop and maintain advanced dashboards and reporting tools to offer real-time insights into operational metrics.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technological advancements to improve data analysis and control methodologies continuously.

Operational Control & Analysis:

Design and implement robust production and sales controlling processes that align with our strategic goals.
Track and analyze critical KPIs to ensure operations run efficiently and meet performance benchmarks.
Prepare comprehensive reports on production and sales metrics, pinpointing trends and identifying opportunities for improvement.

Financial Planning & Strategic Analysis:

Lead the forecasting and financial planning efforts, ensuring accuracy and alignment with business objectives.
Conduct detailed variance analyses, comparing actual results against forecasts to highlight discrepancies and opportunities.
Provide senior management with actionable insights and strategic recommendations based on data analysis.
Cross-Functional Collaboration & Communication:

Collaborate closely with production, sales, finance, and management teams to collect and analyze necessary data.
Effectively communicate analytical findings and strategic recommendations to stakeholders across all levels of the organization.

Who You Are:

A data-driven professional with a passion for accuracy and transparency.
Strong analytical thinker with the ability to balance strategic goals with operational realities.
Technologically adept, with experience in the latest data management and analysis tools.

An excellent communicator who can distil complex data into clear, actionable insights for diverse audiences.

If you are ready to take on a challenging role where your skills in data and operational control will be fully utilized, apply now!

Title: Data Science Sr Analyst
Description:
Overview

Are you ready to drive PepsiCo‚Äôs digital evolution and accelerate transformation across our global operations?

With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data, Analytics and AI (DA&AI) transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo‚Äôs leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise. The Data Science Pillar in DA&AI will be the organization where Data Scientist and ML Engineers report to in the broader D+A Organization. Also DS will lead, facilitate and collaborate on the larger DS community in PepsiCo. DS will provide the talent for the development and support of DS component and its life cycle within DA&AIProducts. And will support ‚Äúpre-engagement‚Äù activities as requested and validated by the prioritization framework of DA&AI.

Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Spain, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics. This Role focuses on Demand Forecasting in the Demand Planning functional area. You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of our continuous delivery of statistical/ML models. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments. You will be an internal ambassador of the team‚Äôs culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an specialist or you are specializing.

Responsibilities

Your day-to-day with us:


Active contributor to code development in projects and services
Act as contributor in innovation activities
Partner with data scientist working on discovery, prototypes and pilot. Focus on experiment tracking.
Partner with data engineers regarding data pipelines and data versioning.
Build, deploy or publish machine learning models that run efficiently in cloud pipelines.
Heavy focus on data wrangling implementation, business rules implementation, feature engineering at scale
Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve quality (unit tests).
Monitor model performance (model decay), working with data scientists assessing bias and fairness.
Prototype new approaches and build solutions at scale.
Support large-scale experimentation done by data scientists.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Create and audit reusable packages or libraries.


Qualifications

What you will need to succeed?


4+ years of overall experience that includes at least 3+ years of hands-on work experience Data Science / Machine learning
Minimum 3+ year of SQL experience and 2+ years of Python and/or Pyspark experience


Skills, Abilities, Knowledge:


Data Science - Hands on experience and strong knowledge of building machine learning models - supervised and unsupervised models.
Knowledge of Time series/Demand Forecast models is a plus
Cloud (Azure) - Experience in Databricks and ADF is desirable
Experience with version control systems like GitHub and CI/CD tools
Experience is Exploratory data Analysis
Knowledge of ML Ops / DevOps and deploying ML models is required
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience building statistical models in the Commercial, Net revenue Management or Supply chain space is a plus
Ability to work with virtual teams (remote work locations); lead team of technical resources (employees and contractors) based in multiple locations across geographies


What makes us different?


Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team with more than 30% of female representation & over 30 nationalities
Have a stake in D&I strategy and bring your whole self to work


About PepsiCo

We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We are agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways to bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization - a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.

So, if you‚Äôre ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we‚Äôd love to chat.


We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability.


#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain

Title: Analyst, Marketing Advanced Analytics, EMEA
Description:
We are looking for a curious, data-savvy individual with strong analytical skills and business acumen to join our team as an Analyst. In this role, you will work with internal and external stakeholders to deliver actionable insights, manage model application processes, and support the 4P Analytics team in driving measurable business impact.

As an Analyst in our Advanced Analytics team, you will be at the forefront of transforming data into strategic business insights, helping HP make smarter decisions and deliver value to customers and stakeholders.

The ideal candidate will have rich experience in building and deploying mix models or managing a category or business directly. You should have a strong curiosity to understand the drivers of business performance and a passion for influencing diverse stakeholders.

Role Responsibilities


Stakeholder Collaboration: Build and maintain relationships with key internal stakeholders, ensuring a thorough understanding of their needs to provide tailored analytical solutions.
Insight Development: Analyze data and model output to select key insights and conclusions, developing comprehensive recommendations for optimizing business and financial performance.
Support Model Application: Work closely with the Data Science team to validate and interpret the outputs of 4P models, ensuring they align with business objectives and provide actionable insights.
Data Integration: Identify and integrate new data sources that can enhance the models' predictive capabilities and improve overall analytical accuracy.
Evaluation of Investments: Consult with business leaders on marketing and advertising strategies, evaluating campaigns for return on investment (ROI) and brand impact.
Deliverable Creation: Prepare and deliver high-quality reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate insights and recommendations effectively.
Continuous Improvement: Partner with the 4P Analytics team to identify opportunities to refine and improve existing processes, ensuring the highest quality outputs.


Role Requirements


Change Agent: Proven ability to influence stakeholders‚Äô behaviours and decision-making through clear, actionable analytics and storytelling. Understands that the power of analytics lies in enabling meaningful, data-driven change. Experience in influencing decisions and driving projects in a complex, matrixed organization is a plus
Business Acumen: Strong understanding of the 4Ps framework and its application in driving business decisions. Ability to translate analytical outputs into business insights.
Analytical Thinking: Excellent problem-solving skills with a proven ability to handle complex data sets and derive actionable recommendations.
Communication Skills: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to present insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Media Mix Knowledge: Familiarity with Marketing Mix Modelling (MMM) and post-campaign evaluation is a plus.
Collaboration Skills: Demonstrated ability to work in cross-functional teams and build relationships with diverse stakeholders.
Project Management: Strong organizational skills with experience managing projects and deadlines in a dynamic environment.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in analytical tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms. Intermediate knowledge of SQL and familiarity with statistical software or programming languages (e.g., Python, R) is a plus.
Experience: At least 3-5 years of experience in advanced analytics, consulting, marketing analytics, or similar fields.
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field such as Business Analytics, Data Science, Marketing, Economics, or Statistics.

Title: Procurement Excellence Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Would you like to join an international team working to improve the future of healthcare? Do you want to enhance the lives of millions of people? Grifols is a global healthcare company that since 1909 has been working to improve the health and well-being of people around the world. We are leaders in plasma-derived medicines and transfusion medicine and develop, produce and market innovative medicines, solutions and services in more than 110 countries and regions.

We believe that diversity adds value to our business, our teams and our culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunities that foster an inclusive environment.

The Procurement Excellence Data Analyst supports the implementation and maintenance of procurement excellence initiatives. This role involves executing day-to-day procurement activities, ensuring compliance with established processes, and providing support to the procurement team..

What Your Responsibilities Will Be


Support procurement excellence initiatives.
Execute daily procurement activities.
Ensure compliance with established processes.
Provide support to the procurement team.
Maintain procurement records and documentation.
Assist with supplier evaluations and performance tracking.
Support the implementation of procurement software and tools.
Conduct routine audits of procurement processes.
Assist in the preparation of procurement reports and presentations.
Support contract management and negotiation activities.
Engage with suppliers to resolve any issues or discrepancies.



Functions And Tasks


Assist in the implementation of procurement initiatives.
Maintain records and documentation for procurement activities.
Ensure adherence to procurement policies and procedures.
Support the procurement team with data and analysis.
Coordinate with suppliers to resolve any issues or discrepancies.
Conduct basic market research to support procurement decisions.
Prepare procurement reports and summaries for management.
Assist in the development and maintenance of procurement databases.
Ensure compliance with ethical standards in procurement practices.
Provide administrative support to the procurement team.
Collaborate with IT for procurement systems implementation and maintenance.
Assist in developing training materials and conducting training sessions.
Monitor and track procurement performance metrics.
Ensure timely and accurate processing of procurement transactions.



Who You Are

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, education, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions).


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or relevant certification in Business, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in procurement or a related field.
Knowledge of procurement processes and best practices.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Good communication and team collaboration abilities..
Ability to multitask and manage multiple priorities.
Basic understanding of market research techniques.
Experience with supplier evaluation and performance tracking.
Knowledge of ethical standards in procurement practices.
Willingness to travel as required for supplier visits and training.
Good problem-solving skills and the ability to handle conflict effectively.
Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
Experience with data analysis and reporting.
Strong organizational and time management skills.



What We Offer

It is a brilliant opportunity for you, Grifols is fully aware that its employees are one of its major assets. We are committed to maintaining an atmosphere that encourages all our employees to develop their professional careers in an excellent working environment.

Information about Grifols is available at www.grifols.com. If you are interested in joining our company and you have what it takes for such an exciting position, then don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!

We look forward to receiving your application!

Grifols is an equal opportunity employer.

Flexibility for U Program: Hybrid Model

Flexible schedule: Monday-Thursday 7-10 to 16-19h and Friday 8-15h.

Benefits Package

Contract of Employment: Permanent position

Location:

Title: Data Analyst II Brand Ads (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY


Advertising performance:
Measure the effectiveness of the implemented commercial initiatives and establish KPIs to assess their performance (e.g., fill-rates, budget exhaustion rates)
Design new KPIs to measure advertising campaigns success (ie. ROAS, New To Brand, Sales Uplift,)
Build data processing pipelines to make data available in Looker Dashboards for Commercial team
To deliver ad-hoc actionable insights and strategic initiatives to solve critical challenges in each market.
Audience monetization:
To use first-party data to build custom user segments that deliver value for advertiser and combine shopping behaviour and category data to enlarge audience capabilities creation
Create segmentation criteria for our 1P data to make it relevant and useful for Advertisers
Build API integrations with different Ads buying platforms (e.g.: DV360, TTD, CDPs)
Sales performance:
Make local teams' life easier by setting up and supporting centralized dashboards with FMCGs Sales, and performance data.
Contribute to continuous enhancement and innovation on how local teams consume data and share it with brands to unlock new opportunities.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.

What You Will Bring To The Ride


3-5 years of professional work experience on analytics in a similar/relevant industry experience in a data analytics role, preferably in advertising facing teams
Demonstrated proficiency in working with clean & optimized SQL and python, querying mid to large volumes of data.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Excellent spoken and written English
Experience working on FMCG/CPG in Analytics is a Plus.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Dynatrace‚Äôs tools generate mountains of data, a lot of which clients don‚Äôt know how to make use of‚Ä¶that‚Äôs where you come in. You will turn that mountain of data into invaluable insight. As someone who lives and breathes data, analysis and problem solving, you will help your clients understand the right performance data, in the right context. You‚Äôll turn that data into business altering insight which enables your client to take the right action to improve overall site performance and user experience that maximizes business outcomes.

You will help clients set a strategy for how they can optimize both their current performance and build performance into their culture.

Responsibilities include:


Account management for 8+ clients, including managing the relationship and customer expectations, providing value and helping to grow your accounts; running all customer touchpoint meetings
Working as an extension of your client's team and the Dynatrace product through ad-hoc analysis, testing initiatives, configuring Dynatrace offerings to get to answers faster, and training and enablement
Creating detailed analysis for your clients by finding answers from the Digital Experience data through reporting, dashboarding, or technology expertise
Representing your client within the rest of Dynatrace for Digital Experience Monitoring (DEM) issues
Additional responsibilities include working with our team to improve process, identify training gaps and share ideas


What Will Help You Succeed

Minimum Requirements:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or other quantitative disciplines is required.
3- 5 years of experience with data analysis, including looking at and distilling complex sets of data and presenting findings in an engaging way


Preferred Requirements:


Experience in data driven analysis - excellent at working with, understanding, analyzing data
Strong understanding of web technologies including HTML, JS, CSS, networking, Content Delivery Networks, Cloud; basic understanding of Chrome Dev and Webpage test
Proficient with analysis tools including Google Analytics, Adobe, Advanced Excel, Tableau, SPSS, R, etc.
Stellar conceptualization and communication skills. Demonstrated ability to bring business and technical people together around clear product concepts, and to motivate them to deliver whole, working solutions
Operates with a customer first focus
Proven ability to work under pressure and to handle multiple conflicting priorities
Recognizes and understands both personal and team dynamics and relationships, is empathetic to stakeholder concerns and effectively influences and persuades


Why you will love being a Dynatracer


A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset with Dynatracers from different countries & cultures all over the world, and English as the corporate language that connects us all
A culture that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.

Please review the Dynatrace privacy policy here: https://www.dynatrace.com/company/trust-center/policies/recruitment-privacy-notice

Title: Operations Data Analyst
Description:
J.JUAN GROUP a leading group in the development and manufacture of control cables, hydraulic hoses and braking systems for motor vehicles, operates in sectors such as automobiles, trucks, ATVs, motorcycles and scooters.

With production plants in Gav√† and St. Cugat in Barcelona and Jiaxing in Shanghai, as well as working with suppliers and customers from offices in the USA, Japan and India, J.Juan has become an indispensable player in the motorcycle industry.

It has more than 600 employees in 4 countries, more than 15% work in R&D. In 2019, its turnover reached 72 million euros shared between Europe, America and Asia with 50%, 30% and 20% respectively.

Our business operations are focused on meeting our customers' needs by offering the highest product quality and a high level of continuous development, progress and innovation. Providing personalized service and product catalog versatility. Its main asset is its trusted network of major customers. We are OEM of world market giants.

In November 2021, J.Juan Group was adquired for Brembo. With this transaction, Brembo continues its journey to become a trusted solutions provider. The acquisition of J.Juan will enable the Group to complete its range of solutions for motorcycle braking systems and expand its family of brands in the growing motorcycle sector.

At JJUAN GROUP we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment by offering equal opportunities and considering qualified candidates without distinction.




SCOPE AND PURPOSE




To support Production Area in root cause analysis and scenario design based on a reliable and timely data analysis activities, being the plant focal point for the ERP platform.




RESULT AREAS / MAIN ACTIVITIES




‚Ä¢ Supports the team during all the process of production data declaration, collection, production ERP upload and validation;

‚Ä¢ Ensures to fix immediately errors on ERP production transactions, contributing to identify root causes to prevent it;

‚Ä¢ Trains the team on execution of related ERP production activities ( production declaration, validation, utilization);

‚Ä¢ Reports about industrial KPIs and production costs, supporting team on continuous improvement activity;

‚Ä¢ Analyses production dashboards to identify trend, highlighting deviations to the production area.




Requirements:




Demonstrable experience in a manufacturing company.

Ability to perform cost and data analysis and daily use of Excel, Power BI.

Bachelor's degree in Economics, Operations or related field.

2 years experience in a similar position within an international company.

Spoken and written English is a must.




Soft skills:




Willingness to improve, participating in the coming changes, etc

Open mindset, creativity and proactivity

Analytical skills, communication skills Strong decision-making and organizational skills

Ability to present complex information to diverse audiences Team work




What do we offer you?




‚Ä¢ To be part of a first class team of professionals, in constant growth and development.

‚Ä¢ Competitive salary.

‚Ä¢ You will be able to enjoy a wide range of training opportunities.

‚Ä¢ Flexible remuneration (nursery, restaurant, health insurance...).

‚Ä¢ Full working day with flexible hours.

‚Ä¢ Friday departure at 14h.




The company guarantees the processing of data in accordance with the European Regulation No. 2016/679, referring to the privacy policy available by continuing with this application. We will only respond to applications deemed to be of interest both in relation to the vacant position and to other positions that may arise from time to time. Brembo considers it essential to respect the principle of equal treatment, being prohibited and excluded any form of discrimination or harassment, direct or indirect, agaiagainstnst any person.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About PayXpert

PayXpert is the payments solution built to provide the best experience to any business and in every customer journey.

PayXpert is one of the most prominent Fintech companies in the payments sector. The firm offers innovative payment processing solutions, and currently services 650+ clients, including global brands.

With a wide range of payment processing services focusing on revenue optimization, BI and anti-fraud; as well as alternative payments such as WeChat and Alipay, PayXpert leads the way in payment innovation!

We are invested not only in our clients, but in our employees as well! We believe in equal employment opportunity, a culture built around gender-balanced development opportunities of our professionals, a flexible and healthy working environment, and general equality in the workplace.

PayXpert is part of the Societe Generale Group.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities


Develop proposed projects such as automated processes, reporting improvement, and metrics forecasting, among others.
Design, build and maintain business intelligence infrastructure to improve the availability and usability of data insights.
Work closely on driving strategic initiatives to improve the quality and timeliness of insights.
Build scalable automation solutions utilizing SQL, Python, Power Bi, Grafana among other tools.
Creation of metrics and dashboards for KPIs.
Provide operational support on maintaining the data functionality in current project developments.
Model in large datasets to measure results and propose key indicators.



We offer


Hybrid Model
Team buildings & Workshops
Permanent Contract
Challenging projects: With us, you will have the chance to participate in a variety of technical projects amongst passionate and skilled colleagues
Free languages courses: learn Spanish, French or improve your English skills at your disposal
Learning Solutions According to your needs
Events: we do believe in the importance of meeting our colleagues in an informal and natural environment to build connections between UK & France & Spain. Please take part on our awesome engagement events‚Ä¶
Referral Bonus
Health Insurance Perk
38h working hours per week



Preferred Candidate Profile

Education


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Computer Engineering, or similar
Bootcamp and/or Computer Science related study
Data Science master‚Äôs degree is a plus



Job Experience


Experience as a data analyst, data science or business intelligence role, focused on building and analyzing large sets of data to solve problems
Python skills for ETL and Machine Learning (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, requests, plotly)
Intermediate knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of visualization, preferably Power BI and/or Grafana
Prior experience using Git



Professional knowledge


A minimum of 4 years of experience in a data analyst role
Communication and analytical skills
Attention to detail with precise and effective communication
Focus and intuition for understanding the needs of the business



Do you want to join and be at the forefront of innovative Fintech Technologies, Immerse yourself in a multicultural and dynamic environment?

We believe in equal employment opportunity, a culture built around gender-balanced development opportunities for our professionals, a flexible and healthy working environment, and general equality in the workplace.

The personal data collected is intended for PAYXPERT and used to process your application with a view to possibly offering you an employment contract. It is intended for use by the departments responsible for recruitment. This information will be kept for a maximum of 2 years if your application is not successful. In accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 on the protection of personal data, you have the right to access, rectify, delete, portability and limit the Processing of Data concerning you. You may also, for legitimate reasons, object to the Processing of your Data. You may exercise your rights by contacting our DPO at the following address gdpr@payxpert.com or at the following postal address Av. Diagonal 440, 08037 BARCELONA, SPAIN. For more information on the Processing of your Personal Data by PAYXPERT, please consult our privacy policy available on our website at the following address: https://www.payxpert.com/privacy-policy/.
