Title: Data Analyst, Partner Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be directly responsible for improving the Partners‚Äô experience across their whole journey, making them grow and improve user UX, from the data perspective. The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented, analytical, and passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship. The role would mean not only providing data and insights to guide the team to make the right decisions but also owning full projects related to the Partners. Ownership and responsibilities will be given to you from day one.

THE JOURNEY


Create and manage core data products that are used to execute impact analysis to evaluate our project performance.
Improve current data sources & reporting to make faster decisions.
Ensure data pipelines and development processes are operationalprocesses operational and efficient.
Work on strategic analysis that will help to detect further opportunities
Understand, deep-dive and have a complete awareness of Glovo‚Äôs partner operations situation at all times. Develop analytical frameworks, analyses, dashboards and models for the whole organization.
Raise product requests to improve partners' UX and scalability. Identify tech feature improvements and give proactive feedback to the Product team.
Execute end-to-end projects at a global level


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1/2 years of experience providing business teams with data for decision-making
Analytical skills: breaking big problems into smaller ones and problem-solving skills, with adaptability to change, is a must
Experience developing in Python and writing complex SQL queries is a must
Experience with reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, and Google Data Studio is a must
Experience with data engineering-related tools (Airflow, Github, etc) is a plus.
Good communication skills in English (plus Spanish as a bonus)
Great team player and organizational skills
Experience in managing projects is a plus
International studies or experience is a plus


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
With Confluent, organisations can harness the full power of continuously flowing data to innovate and win in the modern digital world. We have a purpose that drives us to do better every day ‚Äì we're creating an entirely new category within data infrastructure - data streaming. This technology will allow every organisation to create experiences and use the power of data in ways that profoundly impact the way we all live. This impact is our purpose and drives us to do better every day.

One Confluent. One team. One Data Streaming Platform.

Data Connects Us.

About The Role

This role will be a key member of the Field Reporting & Analytics team to support the Sales and Customer Success Group (CSG) organizations. In this role, you will utilize our business systems data to analyze and provide insight into the organization's historical and forecasted performance. Additionally, this role will apply creativity and analytical thinking to design and implement operational dashboards and ad hoc reporting.

The role requires that you have a strong technical knowledge of database and business intelligence design, and how to transform data into insight so we can utilize world class functional dashboards, reporting, and analysis to ensure data-driven decisions are a daily part of how we work. To do this you will work with our Sales and CSG Strategy & Operations teams to provide business insight.

A background in Salesforce CRM Analytics, Tableau, SQL, experiences supporting sales, pre-sales and/or a post-sales customer business is preferred. This position reports to the Senior Manager, Business Analytics in Field Analytics & Reporting.

What You Will Do


Create and maintain Salesforce CRM Analytics/Tableau dashboards that allow us to measure and effectively execute strategies that guide the Customer Solutions Group & Sales Team to actions and investment
Own core activities for small analytic projects of moderate to high complexity
Gather requirements, design, and build dashboards & analytic reporting based on stakeholders & leadership needs to help monitor performance for all key indicators.
Work with the Senior Manager, Business Analytics to define and maintain a set of data definitions and available measures across the Sales & CSG business
Work with the Senior Manager, Business Analytics to establish a roadmap and rationalization plan for all of our dashboards, reporting, analysis tools, and processes deployed across Sales & CSG


What You Will Bring


BS degree, preferably with a post graduate degree in Data Science, Information Technology, Computing, Business, Operations, or a related discipline.
Relevant industry experience or demonstrable applied knowledge of working with Salesforce CRM Analytics, Tableau or other data visualization software, Salesforce, SQL (large data sets/data warehousing).
The ability to communicate cross-functionally, derive requirements, set and meet deadlines, and deliver insightful analysis and/or models
Keen attention to detail while completing complex tasks
Open, growth mindset and high degrees of self motivation, fostered in a fast-paced, high growth, dynamic environment


Come As You Are

At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

HTML:
With Confluent, organisations can harness the full power of continuously flowing data to innovate and win in the modern digital world. We have a purpose that drives us to do better every day ‚Äì we're creating an entirely new category within data infrastructure - data streaming. This technology will allow every organisation to create experiences and use the power of data in ways that profoundly impact the way we all live. This impact is our purpose and drives us to do better every day.

One Confluent. One team. One Data Streaming Platform.

Data Connects Us.

About The Role

This role will be a key member of the Field Reporting & Analytics team to support the Sales and Customer Success Group (CSG) organizations. In this role, you will utilize our business systems data to analyze and provide insight into the organization's historical and forecasted performance. Additionally, this role will apply creativity and analytical thinking to design and implement operational dashboards and ad hoc reporting.

The role requires that you have a strong technical knowledge of database and business intelligence design, and how to transform data into insight so we can utilize world class functional dashboards, reporting, and analysis to ensure data-driven decisions are a daily part of how we work. To do this you will work with our Sales and CSG Strategy & Operations teams to provide business insight.

A background in Salesforce CRM Analytics, Tableau, SQL, experiences supporting sales, pre-sales and/or a post-sales customer business is preferred. This position reports to the Senior Manager, Business Analytics in Field Analytics & Reporting.

What You Will Do

  • Create and maintain Salesforce CRM Analytics/Tableau dashboards that allow us to measure and effectively execute strategies that guide the Customer Solutions Group & Sales Team to actions and investment
  • Own core activities for small analytic projects of moderate to high complexity
  • Gather requirements, design, and build dashboards & analytic reporting based on stakeholders & leadership needs to help monitor performance for all key indicators.
  • Work with the Senior Manager, Business Analytics to define and maintain a set of data definitions and available measures across the Sales & CSG business
  • Work with the Senior Manager, Business Analytics to establish a roadmap and rationalization plan for all of our dashboards, reporting, analysis tools, and processes deployed across Sales & CSG

What You Will Bring

  • BS degree, preferably with a post graduate degree in Data Science, Information Technology, Computing, Business, Operations, or a related discipline.
  • Relevant industry experience or demonstrable applied knowledge of working with Salesforce CRM Analytics, Tableau or other data visualization software, Salesforce, SQL (large data sets/data warehousing).
  • The ability to communicate cross-functionally, derive requirements, set and meet deadlines, and deliver insightful analysis and/or models
  • Keen attention to detail while completing complex tasks
  • Open, growth mindset and high degrees of self motivation, fostered in a fast-paced, high growth, dynamic environment

Come As You Are

At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst I (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Game Data Analyst (Big Data)
Description:
About Gameloft

Leader in the development and publishing of mobile games, Gameloft¬Æ has established itself as one of the top innovators in its field since 2000. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, two of which are featured in the ‚ÄúTop 10 Games by All-Time Worldwide Downloads‚Äù from App Annie. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt¬Æ, Order & Chaos, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Disney¬Æ, Marvel¬Æ, Hasbro¬Æ, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel¬Æ and Ferrari¬Æ. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 4,600 people worldwide. Every month, 114 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft Advertising Solutions, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company.

All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.

The Game Data Analyst will join the Game Design & Monetization team and contribute to all projects active in the studio by gathering the information required to address important user behavior-related queries for that team and other important internal stakeholders (game managers, producers, engineers, marketing, etc.) and by driving analysis aiming to improve performance and results of the games.

Besides descriptive statistics and metrics, team requests will also include user clustering analysis, modeling, and projections, and DA should be flexible and adapt to any new type of analysis requested.

DATA REPORTING


Satisfy stakeholders data requests through in-house data mining tools.
Deliver clean, accurate and understandable data visualization and dashboards.
Provide on-going reporting and performance monitoring from multiple data sources.


ANALYSIS


Analyze large, complex data sets about the behavior of millions of game players to address strategic and operational business questions
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from mobile / game data to shape features, game economies and future product roadmaps
Develop frameworks, models, and tools to ensure data influences decisions at all levels
Present your findings to cross functional team members in a presentation setting


METRICS GENERATION AND QUALITY


Review metrics generation and ensure quality and accurate delivery of such.
Assistance on management and maintenance of tracking specs.



3+ years of experience with Big Data
Excellent SQL.
Familiarity with BI tools (Looker, Tableau or Power BI).
Proactive, resourceful.
Fluent English level.
At least Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent in relevant technical field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering,‚Ä¶)
Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders.
Videogames player


Bonus Skills


Familiarity with SQL databases and ETL processes.
Familiarity with designing and analyzing A/B tests.
Understanding of advanced statistical methods.
Basic Python knowledge (Pandas/Matplotlib/sklearn).
4+ years of experience with Big Data


Why Join the World of Gameloft?


Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience within a company that is constantly growing!
Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers!
Because you want to be part of an international environment with daily contact with other countries & cultures!
Because you want to work in an inclusive equal opportunity workplace!
Or, just because you‚Äôre looking for a great place to work!



Permanent contract, full-time job with excellent Social Benefits.
25 vacation days per year
Private medical health insurance
Flexible compensation with Ticket Restaurant Card
Free language courses
Birthday day off + option to work a shortened schedule on three days.
Flexible work-from-home hybrid model
Merit based salary progression system and a competitive initial salary package.
Career-development opportunities.
Excellent local working conditions (quality of offices, geographical location of office in the centre of Barcelona).
... and Tuesday and Thursday afterwork beers!


We can‚Äôt wait to find our next great talent!

Join our team, recently recognized in Forbes' top 100 companies to work for! We're gamers from all walks of life, united in creating a culture of inclusivity. Partnering with organizations like COGAM, we ensure a safe workplace for everyone, regardless of background or gaming preference. Whether you're a casual or hardcore gamer on any platform (we're cross-platform now!), we want you to feel like you belong. Be part of shaping the gaming industry with us!

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted and your CV will be saved in our files for a period of 6 months.

Want to know more? Please visit our Website www.gameloft.com

If the offer interests you, Join the Game!

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data ‚Äì we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues


About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you‚Äôll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You


High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner


Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry‚Äôs top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:


A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees


Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city‚Äôs best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don‚Äôt hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Data Science Sr Analyst
Description:
Overview

Are you ready to drive PepsiCo‚Äôs digital evolution and accelerate transformation across our global operations?

With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data, Analytics and AI (DA&AI) transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo‚Äôs leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise. The Data Science Pillar in DA&AI will be the organization where Data Scientist and ML Engineers report to in the broader D+A Organization. Also DS will lead, facilitate and collaborate on the larger DS community in PepsiCo. DS will provide the talent for the development and support of DS component and its life cycle within DA&AIProducts. And will support ‚Äúpre-engagement‚Äù activities as requested and validated by the prioritization framework of DA&AI.

Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Spain, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics. This Role focuses on Demand Forecasting in the Demand Planning functional area. You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of our continuous delivery of statistical/ML models. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments. You will be an internal ambassador of the team‚Äôs culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an specialist or you are specializing.

Responsibilities

Your day-to-day with us:


Active contributor to code development in projects and services
Act as contributor in innovation activities
Partner with data scientist working on discovery, prototypes and pilot. Focus on experiment tracking.
Partner with data engineers regarding data pipelines and data versioning.
Build, deploy or publish machine learning models that run efficiently in cloud pipelines.
Heavy focus on data wrangling implementation, business rules implementation, feature engineering at scale
Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve quality (unit tests).
Monitor model performance (model decay), working with data scientists assessing bias and fairness.
Prototype new approaches and build solutions at scale.
Support large-scale experimentation done by data scientists.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Create and audit reusable packages or libraries.


Qualifications

What you will need to succeed?


4+ years of overall experience that includes at least 3+ years of hands-on work experience Data Science / Machine learning
Minimum 3+ year of SQL experience and 2+ years of Python and/or Pyspark experience


Skills, Abilities, Knowledge:


Data Science - Hands on experience and strong knowledge of building machine learning models - supervised and unsupervised models.
Knowledge of Time series/Demand Forecast models is a plus
Cloud (Azure) - Experience in Databricks and ADF is desirable
Experience with version control systems like GitHub and CI/CD tools
Experience is Exploratory data Analysis
Knowledge of ML Ops / DevOps and deploying ML models is required
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience building statistical models in the Commercial, Net revenue Management or Supply chain space is a plus
Ability to work with virtual teams (remote work locations); lead team of technical resources (employees and contractors) based in multiple locations across geographies


What makes us different?


Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team with more than 30% of female representation & over 30 nationalities
Have a stake in D&I strategy and bring your whole self to work


About PepsiCo

We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We are agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways to bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization - a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.

So, if you‚Äôre ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we‚Äôd love to chat.


We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability.


#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
The Studio Operations team is a global team across 30+ locations and includes Quality Verification and Standards, Central Development Operations, Localization, Animation, Audio, Capture, Rigging and Blendshapes. As a central team, we bring together the best development solutions to further support game teams in achieving their vision and EA's ambition to be the best place to make games.

Within Studio Operations, we are members of the Player & Quality Insights team that focuses on understanding player behavior and designing player feedback events which help game teams develop high-quality games to meet our player's expectations. We are a data-driven team where every major decision starts with data analysis to find opportunity areas and to measure our efforts.

Working alongside our Data Analysts team, you will oversee and conduct the conversion of data into insights to lead to informed decisions. You will help with the development, implementation, testing and maintenance of our data systems infrastructure, including semantic models, dashboards and reports to help teams analyse and investigate their results.

Key Duties And Responsibilities


Conduct data analyses using statistical software, databases and BI tools
Develop and maintain scripts and queries to import, manipulate and clean data from different sources
Create, operate and maintain script-driven methodologies for the generation of analysis and reports.
Perform quality assurance on generated results to ensure accuracy and consistency
Interacting with internal clients
Dealing with data providers in client organizations, specifically in the development of data requests, checking of data received, and follow up with data providers on data issues.
Dealing directly with clients on projects involving technical methodologies
Presenting results to clients in a clear and respectful manner, and maintaining professionalism in collecting feedback
Project management and quality assurance of active projects
Dashboard and Visualization Development
Develop visually appealing and intuitive dashboards
Leverage advanced visualization techniques to effectively communicate insights
Ensure adherence to best practices in data visualization, story building and user experience design

Required


Student of Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Economics or similar studies.
Advanced level of English, both written and verbal, strong communication skills
Strong analytical skills
Knowledge of SQL, R Statistical software and/or Python
Knowledge of Business Intelligence principles and concepts
Interest in gaming is a big plus.


Connect your future to ours. Inspire. Dream. Play.

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist¬†to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ

1. Team and Role

If you have experience working¬†autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©


2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.

3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics¬†experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience in Startup or fast paced environment




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid¬†ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine

5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!


The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1,¬†Cultural Fit:¬†Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2,¬†Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team:¬†Join two members of our Product¬†team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3,¬†Meet the Team:¬†Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check,¬†CEO Chat:¬†Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.
More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!



Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Since 2004 Fragrance Science has been developing and producing fragrances for their application in products for Home Care, Personal Care, Fine Perfumery, dealing with business partners in Spain and abroad. There are around 50.000 references of the fragrances in our database, with different product application, and we strive to constantly deliver a perfect service and fragrance expertise to our clients, adapting to their needs and expectations while working on different projects.




Job description

We are searching for a highly motivated team-player for the role of Data Analyst.




What will your responsibilities be?

Collect data from the company‚Äôs areas to be analyzed, structure it in a way that can be combined with the desired indicators, and hold meetings with department heads to understand how their data is structured and build dashboards that address the analytical needs.
Perform data analysis to generate reports for all company departments.
Experience with Power BI and SQL.




Requirements:

University degree in a related field (Data Analyst).
Excellent English skills.
Minimum of 2 years of experience.




What can we offer you?

Permanent contract.
Immediate start.
Salary based on experience and qualifications.
Stability and long-term opportunities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work from Home Policy‚ÄØand‚ÄØWFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.

HTML:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:


  • Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
  • Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
  • Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
  • Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
  • Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
  • Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
  • Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.


Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.


  • Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
  • 5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
  • Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
  • Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
  • Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
  • Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
  • Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
  • Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
  • Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
  • Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.


What can make you stand out:


  • Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
  • Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
  • Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
  • Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.


Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)


  • Hybrid Work from Home Policy‚ÄØand‚ÄØWFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
  • Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
  • Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
  • Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
  • Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
  • 5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
  • Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
  • Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
  • Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
  • Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
  • Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
  • Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
  • Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
  • Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).

Title: Data & Analytics Trainee
Description:
Job Summary

As a Data and Analytics Trainee, you will embark on a journey to dive deep into the world of data science and analytics. This role is designed for individuals who are passionate about leveraging data to drive insights and make informed decisions. You will be part of a dynamic team of data professionals, working closely with experienced data analysts, BI analysts and data engineers to hone your skills and contribute to real-world projects.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

Analytical Support

‚Ä¢Assist in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing tasks under the guidance of senior team members.

‚Ä¢Learn to navigate and manipulate data using programming languages such as Python or SQL.

‚Ä¢Follow established protocols to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the process.

‚Ä¢Contribute to basic data analysis tasks, such as descriptive statistics, exploratory data analysis, and hypothesis testing.




Visualization and Reporting:

‚Ä¢Assist in creating visualizations and dashboards to communicate data findings effectively.

‚Ä¢Learn to use data visualization tools and libraries to create clear and compelling presentations of analytical results.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python or SQL.
Ability to write and understand basic scripts or queries for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization principles and techniques.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Power BI or QlikSense.
Clear and effective communication skills, both verbal and written in English (as a multinational company, English will be the primary language of communication in the meetings).

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ Senior Data Analyst




Who Are We?




At Interactvty, we empower businesses to create next-generation OTT 2.0 platforms that offer dynamic, interactive experiences for both first and second screens. Our cutting-edge technology delivers seamless compatibility across all Smart TV operating systems, mobile devices, and web platforms.




From delivering live, interactive content to ensuring global reach on-demand, we‚Äôre redefining how audiences connect with media. And now, we‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to help us innovate further.




Why Join Interactvty?




üîπ Innovate at Scale: Work on groundbreaking technology that‚Äôs revolutionizing OTT 2.0 platforms, making media experiences more immersive and engaging.

üîπ Grow With Us: Join a fast-growing company where your ideas and contributions directly shape the future of our products.

üîπ Collaborate Creatively: Work alongside a talented, multidisciplinary team in a culture that fosters innovation, collaboration, and agility.

üîπ Impact-Driven Projects: Be part of a mission to transform how users experience digital entertainment worldwide




What We're Looking For:




Position: Senior Data Analyst

Experience: Minimum of 2 years in data analysis, predictive modeling, or related roles




Your Role:




Design and implement advanced data analysis strategies
Clean and prepare data for accurate analysis and interpretation
Create data models and establish relationships between datasets
Identify patterns and trends that address specific business challenges
Develop clear data visualizations and presentations
Present trends and formulate hypotheses to improve business metrics
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decisions




Technical Requirements:




Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields
Advanced proficiency in programming languages: Python, R, and SQL
Strong experience with data visualization tools: Power BI
Expert knowledge of Excel and data analysis techniques
Experience in statistical analysis and predictive modeling
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent data storytelling abilities




Tech Stack & Tools: Core Technologies:




Python, R, SQL
Power BI
Excel (Advanced)
Statistical Analysis Tools
Data Visualization Platforms




Additional Skills:




Big Data technologies
Machine Learning
Business Intelligence tools
Data modeling and ETL processes




What‚Äôs In It for You?

üí° Innovation at Your Fingertips: Work with one of the most advanced OTT 2.0 solutions in the market.

üìà Career Growth: Unlock your potential with opportunities for leadership and skill development.

üåé Global Impact: Contribute to a platform used by businesses worldwide to create unforgettable experiences.

üéØ Dynamic Work Environment: Join a collaborative team that values creativity, excellence, and continuous improvement.

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



We are looking for a Customer Data Analyst to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveler's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and skilled at analyzing big data sets, keep on reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.



The candidate will have the opportunity to become a key member of the team leveraging the analytical skills to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to work on customer centric analysis and cross domain projects (Loyalty, CRM & Marketing, Login, Consents, APP, etc.).





Job Description



Job Title - Customer Data Analyst



Working model - Madrid or all Spanish territory remotely



Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.



Level - Professional (working in teams or individually on projects, with emphasis on technical/discipline knowledge rather than managing people)



Contract - Permanent - full-time (EUR 36 h/week)







What your impact will be



Data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
Explores and proactively propose new product and business opportunities
Communicates and presents results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables


Qualifications



Your expertise:



At least 2 years of experience in a similar role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Excel.
Good knowledge of data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.
Proficiency in English.





Desirable:



Python
Ability to influence decision makers through presentations of analysis
Familiarity with digital and ecommerce business
Previous experience in the travel industry
Experience in building pipelines and data models


Additional Information



How we work together:
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.
- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O‚Äôreilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.) in line with local laws.


Wish you were here? We do, too!







Selection process steps*:



HR interview (10-30 minutes)
Offline Tech test
1st interview (Manager): with test review
2nd interview (Manager + team member):
Decision making & Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)





Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging



At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.



Eligibility criteria:
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.







Please submit your resume in English
Please submit your resume in English

Description:
About Pepper Group Spain

Pepper Group Spain is investing in the development of a loan servicing platform and broader eco system with the aspiration to provide the modular elements of the platform to internal and third party customers on a SaaS basis.




About the role

As a data analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to provide insights and recommendations to the business. You will work closely with the data team to develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports using Tableau.




Location: Madrid




Main Responsibilities

Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and requirements.
Developing and maintaining data models to support business reporting and analysis.
Creating and maintaining Tableau dashboards and reports to visualize data and provide insights.
Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Communicating findings and recommendations to business stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Ensuring data accuracy and integrity by performing data quality checks and validations.
Staying up to date with the latest Tableau features and best practices.




Your skills

At least 5 years of experience in financial services and data/Tableau experience.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in SQL and data modelling.
Experience with Tableau Desktop and Server.
Ability to create complex queries and visualizations in Tableau.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics)
Strong English skills.




Our benefits

Private health insurance + dental program for all employees from 3rd month.
Tax benefits in services such as day care, commuting cost, health, and food.
Life insurance from day 1 for all employees.
Flexible hybrid working model.
Healthy snacks at the office.
Wellness program with workshops and webinars.
Team building activities such as Christmas, Summer event, Football team.
Voluntary initiatives (Ning√∫n Ni√±o sin sonrisa, Ning√∫n ni√±o sin mochila, Fundaci√≥n Aladina, Asociaci√≥n Espa√±ola Ayuda contra el Cancer, Fundaci√≥n Prader Willi, Guillermo Prieto Ciclista, Bancos de Alimentos)







Pepper‚Äôs values and culture

Our mission is to help people succeed. Our clients, our customers, our employees. Our Values are ‚ÄòCan do‚Äô, ‚ÄòBalanced‚Äô and ‚ÄòReal‚Äô.

Pepper‚Äôs values support our vision, shape our culture and define how we interact with other employees and the attitudes we adopt towards our customers and clients. The values of Pepper support the organisation‚Äôs mission statement.

Pepper Spain‚Äôs unique outcome focused corporate culture aims to deliver fairness and value for clients and customers, consistently exceeding expectations in all measurable performance areas.




Pepper is an equal opportunities employer.

Role Profiles are subject to change in line with business needs.

For more information on this role please email rrhh@pepperservicing.es
