Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Analyst, Crypto and Payments
Description:
About MoonPay üåñüí∏
Hi, we‚Äôre MoonPay. We‚Äôre here to onboard the world to Web3.

Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratising technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.

What We Do
We‚Äôre the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 20 million people around the world now trust our products ‚Äî just take a look on Trustpilot.

We‚Äôre also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.

But that‚Äôs not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. It‚Äôs taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.

So whatever your background, we‚Äôre sure there‚Äôs something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.

About The Opportunity ‚úçÔ∏è
This is an opportunity for an ambitious Data Analyst to have a huge impact across the organization, while working in a complex and rapidly changing crypto environment. We are looking for someone with experience or an interest in end-to-end ‚Äúfull-stack‚Äù data work, including: data strategy, analytics engineering, (advanced) analytics and data science. The main focus of this position will be to play a crucial role in supporting our Accounting and FP&A functions.

What You Will Do


Build robust data models and infrastructure downstream of backend services and external data sources, which support reconciliation, internal reporting, and ad-hoc analysis
Develop ‚ÄúThe Ledger‚Äù, which tracks all our crypto and fiat movements from external data sources
Design, build and scale a MoonPay-wide approach to reconciliation for cash and crypto using both internal and external data sources.
Conduct more strategic analysis on specific topics such as the Flow of Funds from both a cash and crypto perspective
Collaborate with the finance team and the crypto engineering team to conduct investigations into areas such as issues with crypto delivery
Working closely with accounting & finance to build custom tables & reporting to support their efforts.
Communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences (across different teams)
Collaborate cross-functionally with other teams on Product, Engineering, and Finance





About You
As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be expected to work cross-functionally with different parts of the organization while maintaining a focus on Data and Finance. Being someone who can build robust data models to contribute to the current ecosystem of data products. We are seeking someone with experience or an interest in ‚Äúfull-stack‚Äù data work, from data engineering to data analytics.

What You Will Need


Advanced SQL, data modeling, and data visualization tools are second nature to you
You have experience of and/or interest in working with a finance team, or within a finance function
You have the versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job and adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment
You are experienced in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including finance managers, engineers, VP & C-level executives





Most importantly, though, you will embody the core principles that everyone here at the MoonPay lives by. Our ‚ÄúBLOCK Values‚Äù are at the heart of everything we do - and they are‚Ä¶

B - Be Hungry

L - Level Up

O - Own It

C - Crypto Curious

K - Kaizen

MoonPay Perks
Equity package üìà

Unlimited holidays üèù

Paid parental leave üçº

Annual training budget üíª

Home office setup allowance ü™ë

Monthly budget to spend on our products üí∞

Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless üöÄ

Freedom, autonomy and responsibility üí™

Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative, and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel that you are only a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.

Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview process, and we‚Äôll do our best to provide assistance.
Commitment To Diversity
At MoonPay we believe that every voice matters. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination. That‚Äôs why we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are a proud equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including, but not limited to, hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, and leave of absence.

MoonPay is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our job application procedures for qualified individuals with disabilities. Please inform our Talent Team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Please be aware that MoonPay does not request an AI-led interview without seeing a recruiter or team member from MoonPay on video call. We won't ask for your personal identification documents or any money from you during your interview process with us. Be fraud smart! If you receive an email - claiming to be from MoonPay - but from an email address ending in anything other than @moonpay.com, please be aware that this is not us.

Title: Data & Analytics Trainee
Description:
Job Summary

As a Data and Analytics Trainee, you will embark on a journey to dive deep into the world of data science and analytics. This role is designed for individuals who are passionate about leveraging data to drive insights and make informed decisions. You will be part of a dynamic team of data professionals, working closely with experienced data analysts, BI analysts and data engineers to hone your skills and contribute to real-world projects.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

Analytical Support

‚Ä¢Assist in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing tasks under the guidance of senior team members.

‚Ä¢Learn to navigate and manipulate data using programming languages such as Python or SQL.

‚Ä¢Follow established protocols to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the process.

‚Ä¢Contribute to basic data analysis tasks, such as descriptive statistics, exploratory data analysis, and hypothesis testing.




Visualization and Reporting:

‚Ä¢Assist in creating visualizations and dashboards to communicate data findings effectively.

‚Ä¢Learn to use data visualization tools and libraries to create clear and compelling presentations of analytical results.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python or SQL.
Ability to write and understand basic scripts or queries for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization principles and techniques.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Power BI or QlikSense.
Clear and effective communication skills, both verbal and written in English (as a multinational company, English will be the primary language of communication in the meetings).

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist¬†to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ

1. Team and Role

If you have experience working¬†autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©


2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.

3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics¬†experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience in Startup or fast paced environment




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid¬†ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine

5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!


The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1,¬†Cultural Fit:¬†Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2,¬†Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team:¬†Join two members of our Product¬†team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3,¬†Meet the Team:¬†Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check,¬†CEO Chat:¬†Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.
More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!



Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are BOB, a hybrid L2 to build and launch Bitcoin applications. Our mission is accelerating the world's transition to a fair and transparent financial system through Bitcoin as a credibly neutral, global settlement asset. We believe in a world with access to finance for everyone, everywhere, in a secure and usable manner.

As a Data Analyst for BOB, you will be leading the quantitative insights to grow and direct decisions at BOB. You are the main person responsible for analysing various on- and off-chain data sources to create and track KPIs and identify trends with a deep product understanding. You will work closely with the product, business, and marketing teams to formulate hypothesis and deliver actionable recommendations focussing on DeFi on BOB.

What You Will Do


Product Metrics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key performance metrics, including channel performance, user activation and retention, TVL, trading volume, and other KPIs
Market Research: Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify emerging trends within the Bitcoin and DeFi ecosystem
Identify DeFi Opportunities: Regularly prepare and update reports about investment opportunities on BOB for our institutional partners
Data Infrastructure: Together with the engineering team, design and build foundational data systems, including ETLs, dashboards, and analytics that drive data-driven decision-making and support scalable business growth



Requirements


Proven ability to lead complex analytical projects from concept to completion, especially in web3 environments
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python through your experience as business or data analyst or other quant-related position
Deep understanding of DeFi, including protocols, block explorers, and data sources
Eagerness to improve products through fast experimentation, A/B testing, and a data-driven approach
Enjoy working in a results-driven and fast-paced startup environment



Benefits


Research-oriented team
Solve novel problems
Stock options
Remote working
30-day vacation
Allowance for a co-working space
Yearly retreat
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Crypto and Payments
Description:
About MoonPay üåñüí∏
Hi, we‚Äôre MoonPay. We‚Äôre here to onboard the world to Web3.

Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratising technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.

What We Do
We‚Äôre the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 20 million people around the world now trust our products ‚Äî just take a look on Trustpilot.

We‚Äôre also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.

But that‚Äôs not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. It‚Äôs taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.

So whatever your background, we‚Äôre sure there‚Äôs something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.

About The Opportunity ‚úçÔ∏è
This is an opportunity for an ambitious Data Analyst to have a huge impact across the organization, while working in a complex and rapidly changing crypto environment. We are looking for someone with experience or an interest in end-to-end ‚Äúfull-stack‚Äù data work, including: data strategy, analytics engineering, (advanced) analytics and data science. The main focus of this position will be to play a crucial role in supporting our Accounting and FP&A functions.

What You Will Do


Build robust data models and infrastructure downstream of backend services and external data sources, which support reconciliation, internal reporting, and ad-hoc analysis
Develop ‚ÄúThe Ledger‚Äù, which tracks all our crypto and fiat movements from external data sources
Design, build and scale a MoonPay-wide approach to reconciliation for cash and crypto using both internal and external data sources.
Conduct more strategic analysis on specific topics such as the Flow of Funds from both a cash and crypto perspective
Collaborate with the finance team and the crypto engineering team to conduct investigations into areas such as issues with crypto delivery
Working closely with accounting & finance to build custom tables & reporting to support their efforts.
Communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences (across different teams)
Collaborate cross-functionally with other teams on Product, Engineering, and Finance





About You
As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be expected to work cross-functionally with different parts of the organization while maintaining a focus on Data and Finance. Being someone who can build robust data models to contribute to the current ecosystem of data products. We are seeking someone with experience or an interest in ‚Äúfull-stack‚Äù data work, from data engineering to data analytics.

What You Will Need


Advanced SQL, data modeling, and data visualization tools are second nature to you
You have experience of and/or interest in working with a finance team, or within a finance function
You have the versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job and adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment
You are experienced in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including finance managers, engineers, VP & C-level executives





Most importantly, though, you will embody the core principles that everyone here at the MoonPay lives by. Our ‚ÄúBLOCK Values‚Äù are at the heart of everything we do - and they are‚Ä¶

B - Be Hungry

L - Level Up

O - Own It

C - Crypto Curious

K - Kaizen

MoonPay Perks
Equity package üìà

Unlimited holidays üèù

Paid parental leave üçº

Annual training budget üíª

Home office setup allowance ü™ë

Monthly budget to spend on our products üí∞

Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless üöÄ

Freedom, autonomy and responsibility üí™

Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative, and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel that you are only a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.

Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview process, and we‚Äôll do our best to provide assistance.
Commitment To Diversity
At MoonPay we believe that every voice matters. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination. That‚Äôs why we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are a proud equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including, but not limited to, hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, and leave of absence.

MoonPay is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our job application procedures for qualified individuals with disabilities. Please inform our Talent Team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Please be aware that MoonPay does not request an AI-led interview without seeing a recruiter or team member from MoonPay on video call. We won't ask for your personal identification documents or any money from you during your interview process with us. Be fraud smart! If you receive an email - claiming to be from MoonPay - but from an email address ending in anything other than @moonpay.com, please be aware that this is not us.

Title: BI Analsyt
Description:
Hi, we‚Äôre Fever

We‚Äôre excited you are checking out this job offer.

We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment.

How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.

Sounds amazing, right?

BILLING SPECIALIST:

Fever is looking for an Analyst that will play a vital role in taking our products to the next level, deepening/ widening our current understanding of our users and identifying improvement opportunities for our product. We're looking for someone with great analysis skills, the ability to get things done and a genuine interest on our customers.This is the perfect position for someone who knows a variety of techniques and tools related to data analysis (examples of techniques: SQL, clustering, predictive models, pattern recognition, examples of tools: Excel, R, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc) with Finance Background and loves digging into data to uncover product/business problems and opportunities.You will work closely with different areas of the business, mainly Finance and Business Development.We also value the ability to understand how to prioritize, think on how things will scale, make tradeoffs and balances the business needs with technical constraints .

Key responsibilities


Auditing of Invoices, payments and current reporting & analytics oriented to Finance & Billing
Auditing any changes to ensure data accuracy and normalization of data
Completing critical analysis that will drive growth and provide insights about payments, invoices and commissions
Develop, Maintain and enhance through automatization current control and working sheets
Generate queries and reports for better controls and operations


About you


Bachelor‚Äôs degree with Engineering/Finance/Auditing background required.
0-2 Years of relevant experience
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; strong bias towards data-based decision.
To love everything data - designing models, reporting, driving results/growth
Excellent written and spoken English
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, business owners, and senior business leaders.
High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.


Preferred Qualifications


VBA, Python preferred; Strong Excel/Google Sheets knowledge required.
An excellent understanding of SQL or other query languages preferred
Experience in a cross-functional team.


Benefits and Perks


Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution
Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Madrid scene
Home-office friendly
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with
40% Discount on all events on Fever
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English Lessons
Gympass Membership
We have free food, drink and fruit at the office!
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow


Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
NUDE means Freedom

No tener que seguir el camino tradicional y poder crear por ti mismo la vida que deseas. Siempre siguiendo tu pasi√≥n.

PROJECT means Process

Algo que est√° en proceso, que nunca se va a acabar y sigue cre√°ndose cada d√≠a. Un lienzo en blanco infinito donde siempre hay lugar para crear m√°s.

NUDE PROJECT va mucho m√°s all√°. Nuestras prendas tienen como objetivo inspirar a las nuevas generaciones a perseguir su pasi√≥n. A ra√≠z de un proyecto universitario que comenz√≥ hace tan solo 5 a√±os, hemos pasado de preparar los primeros pedidos en nuestra habitaci√≥n de la residencia a vender m√°s de 10 millones de euros.

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



We are looking for a Customer Data Analyst to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveler's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and skilled at analyzing big data sets, keep on reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.



The candidate will have the opportunity to become a key member of the team leveraging the analytical skills to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to work on customer centric analysis and cross domain projects (Loyalty, CRM & Marketing, Login, Consents, APP, etc.).





Job Description



Job Title - Customer Data Analyst



Working model - Lisbon or all Portuguese territory remotely



Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.



Level - Professional (working in teams or individually on projects, with emphasis on technical/discipline knowledge rather than managing people)



Contract - Permanent - full-time (EUR 36 h/week)







What your impact will be



Data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
Explores and proactively propose new product and business opportunities
Communicates and presents results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables


Qualifications



Your expertise:



At least 2 years of experience in a similar role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Excel.
Good knowledge of data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.
Proficiency in English.





Desirable:



Python
Ability to influence decision makers through presentations of analysis
Familiarity with digital and ecommerce business
Previous experience in the travel industry
Experience in building pipelines and data models


Additional Information



How we work together:
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.
- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O‚Äôreilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.) in line with local laws.


Wish you were here? We do, too!







Selection process steps*:



HR interview (10-30 minutes)
Offline Tech test
1st interview (Manager): with test review
2nd interview (Manager + team member):
Decision making & Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)





Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging



At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.



Eligibility criteria:
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.







Please submit your resume in English
Please submit your resume in English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Req Number: 88940

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2‚Äì4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports

Title: Data Intern
Description:
At adidas Porto, our diverse team of over 900 employees, representing 40 nationalities, creates a powerful mix of global talent. Located in Maia, Porto, this location covers key areas such as Finance, Procurement, Accounts & Sales Ops, HR & Payroll, Supply Chain, Digital, Tech, and Data, among others.

We are running internships in 3 different Data areas: Data Science, Machine Learning, and Product Ownership.


As a Data Science intern, you'll support a proof of concept for Advanced Analytics within adidas' global supply chain. Your focus may include exploring machine learning applications for areas like global sourcing and customs, as well as potential uses of Generative AI.
As a Machine Learning intern, you‚Äôll help bridge the gap between advanced AI research and practical, scalable solutions, empowering businesses across various domains. Join a project focused on designing user-friendly tools and frameworks to bring Generative AI into real-world industry applications.
As a Data Product Owner intern, you'll support the Demand Planning team by gathering and translating business requirements into Jira stories for the data engineering team. You'll work closely with stakeholders to ensure the requirements are clear, actionable, and aligned with project goals. Your role will also involve prioritizing tasks and ensuring smooth team communication to drive efficient product development.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


Master's students in statistics, physics, mathematics, IT, system engineering, or related.
Enrolled in a Portuguese university and eligible for a curricular internship.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written.


WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?


A paid internship up to 9 months with other adidas benefits.
Hybrid work policy and flexible working hours.
A sports-driven, international and diverse work environment.
State-of-art office space and conditions.


HOW WILL THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS BE?


Step 1. Apply with your English Resume.
Step 2. You'll receive a WePow for a pre-recorded video interview.
Step 3. You'll be invited for an on-site interview in our office.


The start date for this internship will be March 10th 2025.

adidas celebrates diversity, supports inclusiveness and encourages individual expression in our workplace. We do not tolerate the harassment or discrimination toward any of our applicants or employees. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

‚Ä¢ BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

‚Ä¢ Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

‚Ä¢ Power BI Experience;

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

‚Ä¢ Fluent English (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek üöÄ, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe üåé supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




üáµüáπ Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center ‚Äì Sodexo Business Services ‚Äì SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several üìäüßæFinancial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







üí• Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




üíº We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




‚öô What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




ü§ô What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master‚Äôs degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.




üéâ What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee‚Äôs birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team¬¥s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that¬¥s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
üöÄ Let's shape the future, together!


We are a 100% Portuguese technology consulting company, but with our eyes set on the entire universe. We develop efficient and innovative solutions in the areas of IT, Big Data and Telecom and we strongly believe that you are next in line to help us shape the future.


Be the NEXT Data Analyst!


What we value:


‚Ä¢ BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

‚Ä¢ Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation;

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA;

‚Ä¢ Alteryx experience: + 2 years;

‚Ä¢ Good Knowledge of SQL.

‚Ä¢ Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.


Nice to Have:

‚Ä¢ Power BI;

‚Ä¢ Previous experience on financial area;

‚Ä¢ Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban);

‚Ä¢ French.


Your main roles:

‚Ä¢ Work closely with business users to understand their requirements to solve business problems;

‚Ä¢ Translate these requirements into an Alteryx workflow, working with other IT teams, local and otherwise, to make data processed and available for users;

‚Ä¢ Develop the workflows following the IT software development governance rules;

‚Ä¢ Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary deliver the data projects;

‚Ä¢ Maintain and do the evolution of created assets during the projects.


What we offer you:

A young and dynamic environment.

Guidance on career progression and development.

Personalized and continuous support.

A training program tailored to your needs.

The opportunity to be part of a constantly growing team.


Your NEXT step is right here!

‚Ä∫ Send your CV to your@nextengineering.pt with the reference SMA

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.




What are we looking for?




Your text is clear and professional. Here's a slightly polished version to improve readability and consistency:
3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence.
Solid experience with Power BI, including a strong understanding of its architecture.
Proficiency in ETL processes, Data Warehousing development, and maintenance.
Experience in T-SQL, DAX, Power Query, PowerShell scripting, and Rest APIs.
Good knowledge of Microsoft technologies (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS).
Familiarity with Power Platform (Power Automate and Power Apps) and Microsoft tools is a plus.
Proficiency in English, with strong communication skills to present ideas clearly and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
French is a plus.
Residence in Porto (mandatory requirement).




What do we have to offer you?

Health Insurance;
Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
Working model: hybrid/remote/on-site;
A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
Events and Teambuildings.




What makes us different?

Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
Reference prizes and birthday present;
We don‚Äôt have a dress code;
We know your name and all address each other informally;
You will grow in good company.Isn‚Äôt this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?




If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you!




We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

Title: Data Analyst - Python, PowerBI & Tableau
HTML:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

‚Ä¢ DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;

‚Ä¢ DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;

‚Ä¢ DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.


Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.


We are looking for a Data Analyst - Python, PowerBI & Tableau for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • Follow-up and coordination of scrum backlog features;
  • Document the components and operation of application: Software Architecture, Technical Architecture and monitoring & alarmistic;
  • Have experience in Support L2 and L3;
  • Good knowledge of scripting languages as Python or other data language;
  • Good knowledge of ticking system as Jira or service now;
  • Good knowledge of Power BI, Tableau;
  • Good knowledge of OLAP concepts, such as SSAS;
  • Good knowledge of Data structures and algorithms;
  • Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).
  • The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data analyst (Alteryx)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

In this project you will be able to contact with one of the key players in banking in the EU and around the world. Thus, you will be part of a multicultural team that is spread across more than 50 countries and you will help develop solutions in one of these three areas: investments, business solutions or commercial/personal services.

We are looking for a Data analyst (Alteryx) to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • 6+ years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • 2+ years of experience with Alteryx;
  • Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling;
  • Previous experience in Data Preparation workflow modeling;
  • Knowledge of SQL and Data Modeling (DMC);
  • Experience in Data Visualization with Tableau and Power BI;
  • Fluent in English.

Responsibilities

  • Create and maintain DataPrep wokflow and creation of complex macros (Alteryx);
  • Write functional and technical documentation and create Proof Of Concept;
  • Ensure diagnostics and resolution of malfunctions;
  • Participate to the implementation process improvements;
  • Manipulate data to facilitate decisions;
  • Participate in clients and team meetings;
  • Support to the client.

We Offer

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Nimber is a leading technology company. We specialize in providing innovative solutions for businesses to effectively manage and analyze their data. Our team is passionate about using the latest technologies to help our clients make data-driven decisions and achieve their business goals.




Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Power BI Developer to join our team in Porto, Portugal. As a Power BI Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining BI solutions for our clients. You will work closely with our clients to understand their business needs and translate them into effective data visualizations and reports.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain BI solutions, emphasizing Power BI visualizations and advanced DAX functions.
Manage and optimize data processing using Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and related tools.
Write and optimize SQL scripts for data analysis and integration.
Apply advanced analytics techniques using Python, R, and PyTorch.
Ensure data integrity through effective data modeling and adherence to best practices.




Qualifications

4+ years of experience in Business Intelligence.
Expertise in Power BI and complex DAX functions.
Proficiency in SQL scripting and Azure Data Stack (especially Databricks).
Knowledge of advanced analytics, data science, and data modeling.
Familiarity with large corporate BI processes and best practices.




Why Work for Nimber:

- Competitive salary and benefits package

- Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and innovative projects

- Collaborative and dynamic work environment

- Professional development and growth opportunities

- Chance to work with a diverse and international team




If you are passionate about data and have a strong background in Power BI development, we want to hear from you!¬†

Join our team at Nimber and be part of a company that is revolutionizing the way businesses use data to drive success.¬†




Apply now and take the next step in your career!

Join our team at Nimber and be part of a company that is revolutionizing the way businesses use data to drive success. 


Apply now and take the next step in your career!

Title: Business Intelligence
HTML:
Company Description

Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2021, Continental generated sales of ‚Ç¨33.8 billion and currently employs more than 190,000 people in 58 countries and markets. On October 8, 2021, the company celebrated its 150th anniversary.

With its premium portfolio in the car, truck, bus, two-wheel and specialty tire segment, the Tires group sector stands for innovative solutions in tire technology. Intelligent products and services related to tires and the promotion of sustainability complete the product portfolio. For specialist dealers and fleet management, Tires offers digital tire monitoring and tire management systems, in addition to other services, with the aim of keeping fleets mobile and increasing their efficiency. With its tires, Continental makes a significant contribution to safe, efficient and environmentally friendly mobility.

Job Description

We are looking to a Business Intelligence to join our Marketing team in Marketing&Sales. The successful candidate will ensure market analysis in terms of business trends and competitors strategy in order to provide relevant data for decision making and anticipate eventual measures to be taken locally.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor degree/ University degree;
  • 3 years in a similar function (preferred);
  • Fluent Portuguese and English language skills (written and spoken);
  • Good understanding of customer and competitor landscape;
  • Interpretation of CO group and competitor pricing policies;
  • Good command of IT tools to steer operational job content;
  • Proactive, willingness to bring topics forward and a good team player;
  • Strong in driving change and innovation.

Additional Information

We offer:

  • Integration in a challenging and international work environment;
  • Local employment contract with attractive remuneration package and benefits;
  • Hybrid working model (on-site / remote);
  • Agile and collaborative working style;
  • Continuous professional training and excellent possibilities of personal and professional development.

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

Title: Data Analyst w/ Power Platform
Description:
Job Description

Context / team / project


Integrate into our Data Team (ETL, Data Management, BI), working together with NY Data Office, Paris and Porto team members, as a unique team, and help Porto to upskill on this practice.
Bring a differentiating expertise to our clients and stakeholders with integrity and responsibility. (Sustainable impact)
Be agile, accountable, and resilient, according to the circumstances (Entrepreneurial mindset)
Purposely striving to succeed together, Porto and Paris, as one team with openness and confidence to improve knowledge, practice, framework, ecosystem (Collective intelligence).
Contribute on local initiative and project from assessment, use case identification, data preparation, implementation, industrialization‚Ä¶
Contribute to data community.
Animate data awareness, training‚Ä¶


Years Of Experience


> 5 years


Main Tasks & Responsibilities


Work closely with business users to understand their requirements and challenges around data analytics, data reconciliation, and Power Platform solutions.
Translate these requirements into a data workflow, dashboards and/or applications solutions making use of Alteryx and Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
Working closely with business analysts, data scientists, data engineers and developers.
Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary deliver the data and power platform projects.
Drive insights to answer business questions with data and visualizations, transforming data into actionable insights.
Maintain and do the evolution of created assets during the projects.


Qualifications

Main Technical Requirements:


BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.
Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
Good knowledge about SQL.


Other Requirements


Good level of English - minimum B2
Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive
Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku.
A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others;
Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required


Nice To Have


Previous experience on financial area will be a big plus
Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban);
French is a big plus

Title: BI Expert
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Microsoft BI Expert for a project based in Porto (hybrid twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • The role will be transversal across numerous decision-making reporting projects and will participate in all of the following activities:
  • Facilitate/participate in Scrum cerimonies (Sprint Planning/Daily Meeting/Grooming/ Retrospective);
  • Analyze new needs (Estimate complexity);
  • Design and implement Power BI reporting;
  • Design and implement multidimensional and tabular SSAS cubes;
  • Design and implement SSRS reporting;
  • A strong knowledge of MDX and DAX languages is essential for the successful completion of the mission;
  • Fluent English (mandatory);
  • The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Marketing Analyst - Customer Data Analyst
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Customer Data Analyst.

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone‚Äôs day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Analyze Customer Data: Collect, analyze, and interpret customer data from various sources (e.g., CRM systems, web analytics, social media) using tools like SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks to identify trends, behaviors, and insights that drive engagement strategies.
Develop Audience Segmentation: Create and manage detailed audience segments based on customer data, using platforms such as Relay42 to tailor marketing strategies and campaigns to specific customer groups.
Support Marketing Automation: Develop and manage data-driven marketing automation strategies, including segmentation, lead scoring, and personalized campaigns, to enhance customer engagement and conversion rates.
Create and Maintain Dashboards: Design and maintain dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights into customer engagement metrics, campaign performance, and overall marketing effectiveness, utilizing visualization tools and data platforms.


Monitor and Optimize Campaign Performance: Track and analyze the performance of marketing automation campaigns, including those run through Relay42, providing insights and recommendations for optimization based on data analysis using SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks.

What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Expertise in Data Analysis Tools: Proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms such as SAS, Alteryx, Databricks, SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI to analyze and present data.
Experience with Marketing Automation Platforms: Knowledge of marketing automation tools such as Relay42, HubSpot, Marketo, or Salesforce Marketing Cloud, including experience with setting up and managing automated workflows and campaigns.
Audience Creation and Management: Experience in creating and managing audience segments, leveraging data-driven insights to inform targeted marketing strategies and improve engagement.
Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights that drive customer engagement and marketing effectiveness.


Communication and Reporting: Excellent skills in creating clear, concise reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we‚Äôre ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.
